info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 5:00PM MDT until June 26 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CERRO PELADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated persistent light rain over the Cerro Pelado burn scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.10 to 0.33 inches in one hour. Significant runoff and localized flash flooding are expected. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Vallecitos Creek, West Fork Borrego Canyon, Paliza Canyon, Canada Camada and Rio Chiquito. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado burn scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Some locations that may experience significant runoff include... Ponderosa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
